fields.name: distance_along_strip
fields.title: Distance along strip
fields.description: Location of the sample in metres from the top edge of the field. Samples were taken at 10m intervals, with additional samples taken at 5m intervals between 50 and 120 m.

fields.name: soil_depth
fields.title: Depth of soil sampled
fields.description: Depth of soil sampled, 0-23cm, to match the plough layer. At each location 5 samples were taken and bulked in the field.

fields.name: pH
fields.title: Soil pH
fields.description: Soil pH of air-dried soil, using a Jenway 3320 pH meter (Bibby Scientific Ltd, Stone, UK).

fields.name: Olsen_P
fields.title: Olsen P (plant available soil P)
fields.description: Phosphorus concentration in Olsen extract of air-dried soil. 2.5g soil shaken with 50mL Olsen reagent (O.5 M NaHCO3 adjusted to pH 8.5 using 1 M NaOH) for 30 minutes. The extracts were analysed for reactive P using molybdate colorimetry.

fields.name: NaOH_RP
fields.title: Reactive P concentration in NaOH-EDTA extracts
fields.description: Reactive phosphorus concentration in NaOH-EDTA extracts of air-dried soil. 1.5g of soil shaken with 30 mL of a solution of 0.25 M NaOH and 0.05 M EDTA for 16 hours at 22 degrees C, after the method of Cade-Menum et al, 1996.

fields.name: NaOH_TP
fields.title: Total P concentration in NaOH-EDTA extracts
fields.description: Total phosphorus concentration in NaOH-EDTA extracts of air-dried soil. Determined using ICP-OES.

fields.name: NaOH_UP
fields.title: Unreactive P concentration in NaOH-EDTA extracts
fields.description: Unreactive phosphorus concentration in NaOH-EDTA extracts of air-dried soil. Calculated as the difference between NaOH_TP and NaOH_RP

fields.name: TP
fields.title: Total P concentration by ignition
fields.description: Total soil phosphorus concentration of air dried soil by ignition at 550 degrees C for 1 hour, and extraction in 1m H2SO4, with phosphate detection by automated online-neutralization and molybdate colorimetry using a Lachat Quikchem 8500 (Hach Ltd, Loveland, Colorado, USA).

resources.title: Soil data
resources.description: The main data table containing soil pH and phosphorus data measured along the 200m Acid Strip, August 2010, at 10 or 5m intervals. The Acid Strip is a narrow strip of land at the northern edge of Hoosfield, Rothamsted. The strip received large uneven applications of chalk (lime) in the 1850s, and no chalk since. This uneven application of chalk has lead to a dramatic decline in soil pH from East to West. No P or K fertilizer or manure has been applied to the site. Winter wheat is now grown, given 100 kg N ha-1. Full details of the methods and sampling is given in Turner and Blackwell (2013).

name: acid-strip-soil-ph-and-phosphorus-concentration,-2010
title: Acid Strip soil pH and phosphorus concentration, 2010
description:
### Abstract
The Acid Strip is a narrow strip of land on the the northern edge of Hoosfield, Rothamsted. The strip received large uneven applications of chalk (lime) in the 1850s, and no chalk since. This uneven application of chalk has lead to a dramatic decline in soil pH from East to West. No P or K fertilizer or manure has been applied to the site. Winter wheat is now grown, given 100 kgN/ha. This dataset contains the soil pH and soil phosphorus (P) data measured in August 2010, as reported by Turner and Blackwell (2013).
### Methods
Soil samples (0-23cm) were taken from the 200m long Acid Strip at 10m intervals, with additional samples taken at 5 m intervals between 50 and 120m. The soil was air-dried and sieved to <2mm. Soil pH, Olsen P, total P (by ignition) and NaOH-EDTA extractable P were measured.
### Technical Info
- **Soil pH**  using a Jenway 3320 pH meter (Bibby Scientific Ltd, Stone, UK). 
- **Olsen P** extracted with a solution of 0.5 M NaHCO<sub>3</sub>, bufferred at pH 8.5, after the method of Olsen et al, 1954.  
- **NaOH_RP** Reactive P concentration in NaOH-EDTA extracts
- **NaOH_TP** Total P concentration in NaOH-EDTA extracts
- **NaOH_UP** Unreactive P concentration in NaOH-EDTA extracts
- **TP** Total P concentration by ignition
### Provenance
Soil samples taken by the authors in August 2010 from the Acid Strip.
### Quality
All soil sample analysis performance is strictly monitored using in-house standard materials. Standards and check samples are monitored and recorded.
